    • Window

    Window

    A Window class, used to create windows.

    Example:

    // Create a new window:
let newWindow = new windowmanager.Window({
    url: "child.html", // Loads "child.html" based on the current window's url.
    width: 500,
    height: 500,
    show: false // Don't automatically show window on creation
});

newWindow.onReady(() => {
    // Setup window:
    // ...

    // Display window:
    this.show();
    this.focus();
});

    Constructor

    new Window(configopt)

    Creates a window object.

    Example:

    // Create a new window:
let newWindow = new windowmanager.Window({
    url: "child.html", // Loads "child.html" based on the current window's url.
    width: 500,
    height: 500
});
    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    config Object <optional>

    Window Configuration

    Name Type Attributes Default Description
    width Number <optional>
    		 800
    height Number <optional>
    		 500
    frame Boolean <optional>
    		 true

    When true, enables standard OS framing around the window
    resizable Boolean <optional>
    		 true

    When true, allows user to resize window by dragging edges
    show Boolean <optional>
    		 true

    When true, starts the window in the "show" state rather than "hidden"
    icon String <optional>
    		 'favicon.ico'

    Location to favicon
    url String <optional>
    		 '.'

    Location to page that the window should load
    draggable Boolean <optional>
    		 true

    When true, enables dragging of window.
    container String <optional>

    The id of the div to attach the window to

    Extends

    • EventHandler

    Methods

    (static) getAll() → {Array.<Window>}

    Returns a list of all Window instances open.

    Example:

    // Close all windows:
let allWindows = windowmanager.Window.getAll();
    Returns:
    Type:
    Array.<Window>

    (static) getByID(id) → {Window|undefined}

    Returns the Window instance that has id.

    Example:

    // Get window with ID:
let window = windowmanager.Window.getById(windowID);
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    id String | Number
    Returns:
    Type:
    Window | undefined

    (static) getCurrent() → {Window}

    Returns the Window instance that calls this function.

    Example:

    // Get current window this code is executing in:
let currentWindow = windowmanager.Window.getCurrent();
    Returns:
    Type:
    Window

    (static) getMain() → {Window}

    Returns the Window instance that is the main window.

    Example:

    // Get main window of the application:
let mainWindow = windowmanager.Window.getMain();
    Returns:
    Type:
    Window

    dock(other)

    Force docking this window to another. They don't need to be touching.

    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    other Window
    Callback <optional>

    isHidden() → {Boolean}

    Returns true if window is hidden.

    Returns true if window is maximized.

    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean

    Returns true if window is minimized.

    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean

    isReady() → {Boolean}

    Returns true if the Window instance is created, not closed, and ready for method calls.

    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean

    isResizable() → {Boolean}

    Returns true if window is not hidden or minimize or maximized.

    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean

    isRestored() → {Boolean}

    Returns true if window is not hidden or minimize or maximized.

    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean

    isShown() → {Boolean}

    Returns true if window is not hidden.

    Returns:
    Type:
    Boolean

    onReady(callbackopt)

    Calls a callback when window is ready and setup.

    Example:

    newWindow.onReady(() => {
    // newWindow methods can be executed in here
});
    Parameters:
    Name Type Attributes Description
    callback Callback <optional>
